question.content: Wow! There is a certain beauty to a menu of favorites! Though I've never tried strawberry rhubarb, would love to give that a try someday!

referenced_message.content:
Oh geez, it depends on the season, mood, tons of factors. I feel like I've had some really good blueberry pies and they just don't make them enough, so I go out of my way looking for them. But Strawberry Rhubarb is rockin', have had wonderful lemon crostatas, some amazing cherry, pecan there's different styles and when it's nuts all the way through, I love that... Apple is common, but still love it. My dad used to make what he called Mud Pies, but that means different things to different people...
But um... in college, the cafeteria had something I believe they called "Peanut Butter Oreo Creme Pie" and I ate whole pies in a sitting. Like meant to serve 12. Ate it. No regrets.

answer.content: I had not either until my long stay in Canada. Someone there touted it as "the king of pies" so I had to try it. I think that's a bit of a strong statement, but it's ***good***.
